name: Marco Pierre White
bio: Marco Pierre White, born 11 December 1961 is a British chef, restaurateur, and television personality. He has been dubbed the first celebrity chef and the enfant terrible of the UK restaurant scene. In January 1995, aged 33, White became the first British chef to be awarded three Michelin stars. He has trained notable chefs such as Mario Batali, Heston Blumenthal, Shannon Bennett, Gordon Ramsay and Curtis Stone.

recipes.name: Truffled macaroni and cheese
ingredients: 1 truffle, grated or 1-2 tsp of truffle oil
cookingMethod: Cook the macaroni in a large pot of salted boiling water until al dente, then drain and set aside.
In a separate saucepan, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the flour and whisk constantly for about 2 minutes to create a roux.
Gradually pour in the milk, whisking constantly to avoid lumps, and bring the mixture to a simmer. Cook for 5-10 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened.
Add the grated Gruyère and Cheddar cheeses to the sauce, and stir until they have melted and the sauce is smooth.
Preheat the oven to 180°C/350°F.
Transfer the macaroni and cheese to an oven-safe dish, sprinkle with breadcrumbs, and bake for 10-15 minutes or until the top is golden brown and crispy.
Serve hot and enjoy your delicious truffled macaroni and cheese!

recipes.name: Crème brûlée with raspberries.
ingredients: 125g caster sugar, plus extra for caramelizing
1 vanilla pod, split lengthways and seeds scraped out
cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 150°C/300°F.
In a saucepan, heat the cream and vanilla pod and seeds until it comes to a simmer. Remove from heat and let the mixture infuse for 10-15 minutes.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the egg yolks and caster sugar until pale and creamy.
Remove the vanilla pod from the cream and gradually pour the cream into the egg mixture, whisking constantly until the mixture is well combined.
Strain the mixture through a fine sieve into a jug to remove any lumps.
Just before serving, sprinkle a thin layer of caster sugar evenly over the top of each ramekin.
Using a kitchen blowtorch, caramelise the sugar until it forms a crispy layer on top.
Serve the Crème Brûlée with fresh raspberries and mint leaves for garnish.

recipes.name: Lemon tart with raspberry sorbet.
cookingMethod: In a large mixing bowl, rub the chilled butter into the flour until it resembles fine breadcrumbs.
Add the fresh raspberries and lemon juice to the saucepan and bring to a boil.
Pass the mixture through a fine sieve to remove any seeds or solids.
Let the mixture cool to room temperature, then chill in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.
Slice the Lemon Tart into portions and serve with a scoop of Raspberry Sorbet on top.
Garnish with fresh raspberries and lemon zest, if desired.

name: Gordon Ramsay
bio: Gordon James Ramsay, born 8 November 1966 is a British celebrity chef, restaurateur, television personality and writer. His restaurant group, Gordon Ramsay Restaurants, was founded in 1997 and has been awarded 17 Michelin stars overall; it currently holds a total of seven. His signature restaurant, Restaurant Gordon Ramsay in Chelsea, London, has held three Michelin stars since 2001.After rising to fame on the British television miniseries Boiling Point in 1999, Ramsay became one of the best-known and most influential chefs in the world.

recipes.name: Sticky Toffee Pudding
ingredients: 50g unsalted butter, softened, plus extra for greasing
cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 180°C (160°C fan)/350°F/gas mark 4.
Place the chopped dates in a saucepan with 200ml of water and bring to a simmer. Stir in the bicarbonate of soda, then remove from the heat and set aside for 10 minutes.
In a mixing bowl, cream together the softened butter and light muscovado sugar until light and fluffy.
Beat in the eggs, one at a time, then fold in the flour and date mixture until well combined.
Grease a 20cm square baking tin and line with baking paper.

recipes.name: Pan-Seared Scallops
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper
1/2 lemon, cut into wedges, to serve
cookingMethod: First, prepare the scallops by removing the side muscles and any roe if necessary. Rinse them under cold water and pat dry with paper towels.
Heat a non-stick frying pan over high heat and add the olive oil.
Season the scallops with salt and pepper and add them to the hot pan.
Add the garlic clove and thyme sprig to the pan, and let the scallops cook for about 1-2 minutes on each side until they are golden brown.
During cooking, spoon the hot butter over the scallops to keep them moist and add flavor.
If desired, add crispy pancetta to the pan to add texture and flavor, and let it cook with the scallops for an additional 1-2 minutes.
Once the scallops are cooked, remove them from the heat and discard the garlic and thyme.
Serve the scallops on a plate with rocket leaves, and garnish with a wedge of lemon for a squeeze of fresh juice. Enjoy!

recipes.name: Shepherd's Pie
ingredients: 2 medium carrots, peeled and finely chopped
cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Heat the olive oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add the onion, carrots, and celery and cook for about 5 minutes until they are soft and fragrant. Add the garlic and cook for another minute.
Add the ground lamb to the pan and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and cooked through, about 8 minutes.
If the mixture is too liquid, you can add a teaspoon of cornstarch to thicken it up.
Once the filling is ready, remove the pan from the heat and set it aside.

name: Jamie Oliver
bio: James Trevor Oliver born 27 May 1975 is an English restaurateur and cookbook author. He is known for his casual approach to cuisine, which has led him to front numerous television shows and open many restaurants. Oliver reached the public eye when his series The Naked Chef premiered in 1999. In 2005, he opened a campaign, Feed Me Better, to introduce schoolchildren to healthier foods, which was later backed by the government. He was the owner of a restaurant chain, Jamie Oliver Restaurant Group, which opened its first restaurant, Jamie's Italian, in Oxford in 2008.

recipes.name: Crispy Roast Duck
cookingMethod: Preheat the oven to 180°C/350°F/gas 4.
Remove the giblets from the duck's cavity and set them aside. Rinse the duck inside and out with cold water and pat it dry with kitchen paper.
Use a sharp knife to score the skin on the duck's breast and legs in a criss-cross pattern, being careful not to cut into the meat.
Season the duck inside and out with sea salt, black pepper, and the orange zest.
Stuff the duck's cavity with the cinnamon stick, star anise, thyme, garlic, and half of the onions.
Serve the duck with the sauce and your choice of vegetables or sides. Enjoy!

name: Anthony Bourdain
bio: Anthony Michael Bourdain  June 25, 1956  June 8, 2018 was an American celebrity chef, author, and travel documentarian who starred in programs focusing on the exploration of international culture, cuisine, and the human condition. Bourdain was a 1978 graduate of The Culinary Institute of America and a veteran of many professional kitchens during his career, which included several years spent as an executive chef at Brasserie Les Halles in Manhattan. He first became known for his bestselling book Kitchen Confidential: Adventures in the Culinary Underbelly (2000).

name: Bobby Flay
bio: Robert William Flay born December 10, 1964 is an American celebrity chef, restaurateur, and reality television personality. Flay is the owner and executive chef of several restaurants and franchises, including Bobby's Burger Palace, Bobby's Burgers, and Amalfi. He has worked with Food Network since 1995, which won him four Daytime Emmy Awards and a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

name: Thomas Keller
bio: Thomas Aloysius Keller born October 14, 1955 is an American chef, restaurateur, and cookbook author. He and his landmark Napa Valley restaurant, The French Laundry in Yountville, California, have won multiple awards from the James Beard Foundation, notably the Best California Chef in 1996, and the Best Chef in America in 1997. The restaurant is a perennial winner in the annual Restaurant Magazine list of the Top 50 Restaurants of the World.
